Title: Principal Data Scientist (English Speaker)
Description:
Extensive experience in Data Science in the field of AI, leading teams, and do you have a business mindset? One of our clients is looking for a Principal Data Scientist for their office in the center of Barcelona. If you are passionate about data and technology and ready to work in a team full of sharp analytical minds; then take a look at this position!

You will build various Artificial Intelligence products for clients together with your team of Junior and Senior Data Scientists. This is done in two different ways: by providing clients with the product they need, and by working in AI laboratories to develop prototypes as part of R&D initiatives. As a Principal Data Scientist, you are taking the lead of the projects: you are the face of the project to clients, and also within the company.

Tasks

Your responsibilities and impact working as a Senior Data Scientist will be:

Being the project lead of multiple initiatives
Defining the data science modeling strategy and advising on the coding approach
Leading multiple multidisciplinary teams of Data Scientists and Developers and defining the team’s priorities
Leading daily stand-up meetings and sprint planning sessions
Managing team capacity
Resolving conflicts across the functions of the team (DevOps/AI/DB/FE/BE..)
Interacting with the clients and understanding the challenges they face, their needs, and their data


Requirements

Skills, qualifications, and interests you need to succeed in this role:

6+ years of experience in Data Science
6+ years of experience with Python, and experience in R and SQL are a plus. APIs, AWS Lambda, and Step Functions are a bonus and SQL is a plus. This includes package building, object-oriented programming. APIs, AWS Lambda, and Step Functions are a bonus
6+ years of experience in Machine-Learning methodologies
Minimum C1 level of English
Experience in leading and planning of multiple projects
Being able to quickly adapt and work in a fast-paced environment
Having a background in data science consulting or in product development
A Master in Data Science or Machine Learning or AWS Cloud Experience is a bonus


Benefits

What’s in it for you?

Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model: 2 days from the office and 3 days from home
Working in an international and multidisciplinary team
Working together with various multinational companies
Taking project ownership
Working in a rapidly growing environment
Private health insurance
Start date: ASAP


Your Future Company:

A rapidly growing start-up with offices throughout Europe. Founded in 2020 and now already with a team of 80+. With a team of highly skilled ML Engineers, Data Scientists, and Developers they are pushing the boundaries of innovation.

Title: Mobile Developer (Programa Investigo - Agaur)
Description:
Urbiotica




With more than 50.000 sensors deployed worldwide, Urbiotica is leading the smart parking industry and is considered as a pioneer of the Internet of Things fast growing sector. Thanks to its end-2-end solutions for Smart Cities, Urbiotica participates actively in the transformation of the urban areas, creating a more digital and sustainable environment for the citizens.  We would like to integrate a Mobile Developer to join our SW team to develop our Mobile applications.  

 

About the Team  

Our young multicultural and multidisciplinary team is the base of our successes. The work environment and the company values allow all employees to blossom and grow in this exciting entrepreneurial project, launched more than 10 years ago in Barcelona. 




About SW Department 

The software department focuses on managing data send from different types of Hardware and Software sensors in order to extract and generate valuable information for both customers and support/hardware internal teams. We develop different software at all stages of IoT data flow, from data streaming to batch processing, machine learning, AI or visualization tools (Web/apps). 

 

Tech stack 

Our frontend team develops in Flutter for iOS and Android mobile and React and Typescript for Web development. The backend team writes Java and Python to build different software for sensor data streaming, APIs and integrations with 3rd parties. The Datascience team uses Apache Spark and Pandas to process big quantity of data in batch processing and machine learning and IA algorithms to implement sensor detection (both from hardware or software sensors). In order to store all IoT data and then perform multiple analysis over them, we use as a storage layer multiple databases such as SQL (PostgreSQL), non-SQL (HBase) and In-Memory (Redis). Finally, softwares are deployed as microservices in Kubernetes cluster on AWS or On-Premises infrastructures.  

 

Your role 

Within the software development team for mobile applications, you will develop tools that support the research of technologies used in departments that develop IoT sensors. 

You will develop tools for communicating with the devices, configuring them, analyzing the information sent by the sensor and finally displaying all the data on the same mobile device, since the sensors are installed in cities and have a tool that allows you to have sensor information at the moment and quickly facilitates the research of the development team. 




Key Responsibilities 

Develop and maintain mobile applications used to manage and visualize data from IoT sensors 
Develop and maintain mobile application used to configure sensors 
Write production-ready, supportable code 
Self-test your code (Make sure it works!) 




Requirements 

Higher Education Degree 
Interest in mobile technologies and frameworks 
Knowledge of Flutter 
Experience with code versioning (Git) 
Strong sense of responsibility, communication and teamwork skills, willingness to learn 
Experience working with APIs 

 

Nice to have 

Knowledge of Dockers 

 

What we offer 

Indefinite contract 
Ability to learn and grow up as a software engineer 
50% remote time (offices are in Barcelona and there is the possibility to go when you want at the office) 
Working in a young, dynamic and technological environment with years of IoT experience 

 

 

Programa Investigo, finançat per la Unió Europea, Next Generation EU

Title: Senior Python Developer - International company - Healthcare
Description:
Senior Python Developer - International Company - Healthcare




Senior Python Developer - International company - Healthcare SaaS|International SaaS company specialized in Medical Devices and Digital Healthcare




About Our Client




Our client is an international company which has created a disruptive SaaS for the Health-care and Medical devices Sector.




Their SaaS product is based on Python with Django framework. They are working with Microservices Architecture, all hosted in GCP and with also AI components that make this product uniq in the sector.




They have different nationalities in their team and English is mandatory. Their culture is really flexible and they are currently working on a hybrid modality with 4 days of home office (of course you can come when you want).




Job Description




Design and implement new functionalities and architectures using Python and Django.
Design and implement solution architecture to meet functional and non-functional requirements.
Translate business requirements into technical deliverables.
Develop additional features on existing applications.
Modeling, designing, coding, testing automation, scripting, packaging
The Successful Applicant




Highly proficient with Python programming language.
Strong experience with Python frameworks, mostly Django, but if not we also value really positive experiences with Fast Api or Flask.
Proficient with, SQL/NoSQL databases and REST/SOAP webservices.
Experience or an interest in microservices / cloud environments (Docker, Kubernetes, GCP)
Fluent English.
What's on Offer




4 days of remote work per week.
Flexible Schedule.
Free health insurance.
Salary Budget: 40K-55K depending always on the experience.
Contact: Pierre Rivenc




Quote job ref: JN-032023-5992742

Title: Front End Developer
Description:
JOB PURPOSE/ROLE

Are you thinking of next steps in your career path? You deserve a company that really cares about its talent. At Allianz, we are looking for a SW Developer Frontend to be part of our team. Allianz Technology is the internal and unique IT provider of the Allianz Group.

The ideal candidate will prefer the excitement of shaping the technology evolution over following the beaten path and regards highly qualified colleagues not as competition, but as a learning opportunity.

Key Responsibilities

As a SW Developer Frontend, you will be creating UI components according to predefined UX design and interacting with APIs to obtain and update data. Your main tasks will be:


Development of implementation solutions / alternatives and architecture
Feasibility and estimation of effort incl. profitability analysis
Realisation of user stories (via Jira)
Creation of technical concepts (alternative scenarios) for requirements
Technical implementation of the requirements
Technical documentation of changes


KEY REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE


4+ years of software development experience
3+ years of experience with Angular 2+, ECMAScript 6+, NodeJS
Experience with Scrum or other agile methodologies
Self-motivated and able to work efficiently through ambiguity without close supervision
Proficiency in English (B2+)
Eagerness to keep learning
Must demonstrate good judgment and pragmatic approach to delivering software
Understanding of enterprise software design patterns
Understanding on coding guidelines and standards
Experience in using Jira and Confluence


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE (nice to have)


University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent
Experience with Java 8+, WebServices, REST, TDD, MySQL, Maven, GIT, Jenkins, Artifactory, Adobe Experience Manager, Iteraplan, arc42, UML, Sonarqube, elastic search; Kubernetes
Proficiency in German (B2+)
Experience with ABS, NDBX (Expert) library


What Do We Offer


Steady job, you'll get a permanent contract since the first day.
Competitive salary.
Fringe benefits: meal and supplies compensation, life and accident insurance, private pension plan and studies fund. We also offer discounts on other products from the company and shares as well as a Christmas gift card among others. Dare to discover a world of benefits!
Free Birthday day!
Actual work-life balance policies: entry-leave flexibility of 2 hours every day, reduced schedule on Fridays and during the summer, 26 holiday days per year, recoverable working hours, as well as, hybrid workplace model.
Career development: Digital learning platforms, mentoring programs and training sessions give employees the opportunity for personal and professional development.
Relocation Service for international transfers.
Open and international working environment.

Title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist
Company: Institut Català de Nanociència i Nanotecnologia (ICN2)
Description:
Description of Group/Project: Novel Energy-Oriented Materials Group works in materials science and electrochemistry for energy-related applications. It leads several research projects and industrial contracts in energy storage and conversion. We design and synthesise new materials, including graphene and other nanocarbons, nanostructured conducting polymers and hybrid nanocomposite materials for their use in energy storage devices, such as rechargeable lithium batteries or other non-lithium technologies (i.e. sodium and zinc), supercapacitors and hybrid devices.

Este contrato es parte del proyecto PLEC2022-009328 financiado por MCIN/AEI/10.13039/501100011033 y por la Unión Europea NextGenerationEU/ PRTR




Main Tasks and responsibilities:

Development of a novel battery concept based on nanopastes. The main task and responsibilities will be:

- Electroactive nanomaterials preparation and their characterization (CV, FTIR, TEM, SEM...)

- Design and assembly of ad-hoc devices.

- Electrochemical measurements (CV, GCD, Impedance) for cell characterization.

- Post-mortem analysis of cells

- Patent/paper/ reports writing




Requirements:

Education: Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering, Electrochemical Engineering, and/or Chemistry.
Professional Experience:

- Supercapacitors development

- Batteries development and optimization

- Device engineering and their design.

- Preparation of nanomaterials (inorganic and/or organic)

- Characterization techniques for nanomaterials (electrochemical, electronic microscopy, chemical analysis)

Personal Competences:

- Proactivity and Resilience

- Team-working

- Good communication and writing skills in English will be required (Spanish and Catalan desirable).

Summary of conditions:

Full time work (37,5h/week)
Contract Length: 3 years
Location: Bellaterra (Barcelona)
Salary will depend on qualifications and demonstrated experience.
Support to the relocation issues.
Life Insurance.



Estimated Incorporation date: As soon as possible




How to apply:

All applications must be made via the ICN2 website https://jobs.icn2.cat/job-openings/465/postdoctoral-researcher-revolt-novel-energy-oriented-materials-group and include the following:

A cover letter.
A full CV including contact details.
2 Reference letters or referee contacts.

Deadline for applications: 14/04/2023

Title: Associate Principal AI Engineer
Description:
Location - Barcelona (ESP), Gothenburg (SE), Gaithersburg (US)

Competitive Salary + Benefits

Make a more meaningful impact to patients’ lives around the globe

Here you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful difference to patients’ lives. With science at its heart, this is the place where breakthroughs born in the lab become transformative medicines – for the world’s most complex diseases. Answer unmet medical needs by pioneering the next wave of science, focusing on outcomes and shaping the patient ecosystem.

With our ground-breaking pipeline, the outlook is forward-thinking. Be proud to be part of a place that has achieved so much, yet is still moving forward. There’s no better time to join our global, growing enterprise as we lead the way for healthcare and society

The Center for Artificial Intelligence (CAI) is a lab focused on applying machine learning research to the toughest challenges at AstraZeneca. We are a team of experts from different fields including Machine Intelligence, Data Science, Real World Evidence and Bioinformatics.

We innovate together with our leading biologists, chemists, and clinicians to close the gap between today's challenges and the forefront of machine learning. If you want to have an impact on transforming patients' lives by accelerating new medicines to patients, this may be the position for you!

As an AI Engineer you will and help deliver innovative AI research as elegant, enterprise-ready products. As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for developing efficient and scalable processes for the distributed training of large machine learning (ML) models, as well as automating our processes through devops, gitops, and mlops automation to accelerate project delivery and reduce costs and environmental impact.

Key Accountabilities:


Take ownership of software engineering standards within the team and develop documentation and artifacts that make it simple to apply to new or existing projects.
Develop efficient and scalable processes for distributed training of large ML models in both cloud and on-prem environments, working with internal infrastructure teams and external vendors and research institutes.
Drive down costs and environmental impact by automating processes through devops, gitops, and mlops automation, reducing the need for human intervention.
Work collaboratively with broad and diverse teams to deliver projects on time and to the highest standards.


Essential Requirements


Demonstrable record of accomplishment of implementing software engineering best practices for multiple use cases.
Demonstrable experience automating the entire machine learning model lifecycle.
Demonstrable experience optimizing distributed training of machine learning models.
Demonstrable advanced use of Kubernetes and implementation of machine learning tools in that context.
Demonstrable experience collaborating with teams that have different competences.


Desirable Skills and Experience:


Relevant degrees, qualifications, and certifications.
Experience working in a domain subject to regulatory oversight.
Experience working in a scientific research environment.
Understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and its processes.


Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being an excellent Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your ambitious spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society.

An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.

Why we love it

If your passion is science and you want to join a team that makes a bigger impact on patients’ lives, then this is the right place to be. Here we truly understand science and apply it every day to strengthen and grow our pipeline.

So, what’s next?


Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can’t wait to hear from you.
We welcome your application before the closing date 14th April 2023.

Title: Developer
Description:
En LA SALLE CAMPUS BARCELONA - UNIVERSITAT RAMON LLULL, especializada en programas formativos de Ingeniería, Arte y Tecnología, Filosofía, Arquitectura y Empresa precisa incorporar a su Organización dentro del área de Dirección de Investigación e innovación un/a:




DEVELOPER (PROJECTOS DE INVESTIGACIÓN)




La principal misión será garantizar la usabilidad de las aplicaciones que se han desarrollado previamente, cumpliendo con los requisitos exigidos dentro de los proyectos derivados.




Sus funciones serán:




Desarrollo de aplicaciones web con las tecnologías: PHP y con frameworks como CodeIgniter y Symfony aplicando metodologías Agile UX.
Diseño e implementación de interfaces digitales para aplicaciones web.
Actualización del material web de los proyectos de investigación, mantenimiento de aplicaciones y entornos web.
Análisis de usabilidad de las aplicaciones y de las webs implementadas para los proyectos de investigación.




Requisitos del perfil:




Formación: Formación universitaria en Multimedia, Informática o similar.
Experiencia: Experiencia mínima de 1 años en mismas funciones dentro de agencia o empresa.
Otros conocimientos:
Conocimiento medio / alto de Indesign, Illustrator, Photosho, Figma o similares.
Idiomas: Catalán y/o Castellano hablado y escrito.




Se ofrece un contrato temporal de 9 meses y una jornada de 30 horas semanales con un horario a negociar con el área. Entorno dinámico y profesionalizado. Retribución según perfil y experiencia aportada. Incorporación inmediata.

Title: Desarrollador/a de SW Junior
Description:
¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional con las tecnologías más avanzadas del mercado y buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales?




En el equipo de Specialized Technology Engineering (STE) de Deloitte IT Consulting contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales, en continua formación, disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnología del ámbito Cloud, Ominicanalidad, Realidad Digital, entre otras.




Actualmente precisamos incorporar un/a Desarrollador/a de SW Junior con experiencia de al menos 6 meses en Java para participar en el diseño e implementación de las aplicaciones que desarrollamos desde el equpipo de SW en Barcelona, Madrid y Bilbao.




¿Qué buscamos?




Formación: Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones o similares.
Experiencia a partir de 6 meses en la programación con tecnologías Java, Spring MVC, SOAP/REST, Git, bases de datos Mongo DB... Valorable experiencia en Angular, Docker y Kubernetes.
Motivación por seguir aprendiendo en el diseño, creación e implemenación de aplicaciones web en un entorno agile.
Nivel de inglés B2.
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y de espíritu de equipo.




¿Cuáles serán tus principales funciones?




Analizar los requisitos del sistema y de los usuarios.
Diseñar las soluciones.
Desarrollar las interfaces de usuario.
Desarrollar los componentes y mejoras.
Realizar el testing de las aplicaciones de Java
Validar la funcionalidad y la seguridad del software.




En Deloitte, al ser una compañía reconocida mundialmente...




Contarás con un plan de carrera personalizado que te permitirá seguir desarrollando tu potencial técnico, de gestión e incluso especializarte en nuevas áreas. Cada año podrás seguir progresando gracias a la revisión anual de tu categoría profesional y salario en función de tu desempeño.
Podrás beneficiarte de programas de movilidad nacional e internacional que te permitirán cambiar tu lugar de residencia o desarrollar tu carrera en un entorno internacional.
Tendrás participación en la implementación de herramientas y buenas prácticas de desarrollo teniendo guías en cada proyecto además de proyectos que apuestan por tecnologías punteras.
Explotarás tu potencial gracias a un plan de formación continua adaptado a tus necesidades e inquietudes tanto a nivel técnico como de habilidades e idiomas. Te rodearás de grandes profesionales con amplio conocimiento, donde nunca dejarás de aprender y también tendrás la posibilidad de enseñar.
Posibilidad de certificarte en las últimas tecnologías de Cloud (Azure, Google, AWS)
Tendrás la oportunidad de formar parte de un equipo joven, dinámico y con un excelente ambiente de trabajo. Organizamos eventos a lo largo del año donde podrás conocer compañeros/as y ampliar tu red social!
Por otro lado, dispondrás de un plan de retribución flexible como: ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant/guardería/transporte, descuentos y promociones especiales para empleados, unos de los mejores seguros médicos del mercado, Talleres de responsabilidad social… Y si te interesa mejorar tu inglés, ¡podrás asistir a clases de forma gratuita!




What impact will you make?

Title: Python AWS Developer
Description:
Our opportunity

LiveWell by Zurich is a digital, health and wellbeing solution designed to engage and support corporates, employees and individuals on their health journey. We operate in global and local markets with the key mission of creating healthier, happier lives. Zurich LiveWell Services and Solutions Ltd (“Zurich LiveWell”) takes a holistic approach to health and wellbeing across physical, mental, financial and social health because all these areas need to be in balance to drive optimal performance.

Our aim is to empower individuals to own their total health and wellbeing through health education, best-practice prevention focused on lifestyle activities, goal setting, health challenges and responsive health services such as telemedicine.

Your role

In this role you work as a Python Developer in one of our Squads with PO, UX/UI, other Flutter Developer and Backend Developers to build features for our LiveWell proposition. You will work on our AWS code written in Python.

Each Squad consists of a Product Owner (PO), UX/UI Designers, Frontend and Backend Developers, and QA.

As a Phyton AWS Developer your main responsibilities will involve


Develop Python code for AWS services
Testing of developed features
Unit tests of developed features
Manage tasks on DevOps sprint boards


Your Skills And Experience

As a Phyton AWS Developer your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


Proven record in building Python code for AWS services
API documentation frameworks (Swagger, RAML, OpenAPI spec)
Dynamodb, SNS, SQS, Lambda, Appsync, Apigateway, Aurora (Postgresql), s3,
Essential experience is working in a multicultural environment
Being able to communicate in English with fluency


Additional Information

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:


Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 80%
Flexible working hours
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant
Life and Health Insurance
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions
Exclusive Employees discounts


Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English and portfolio by clicking on the button “Apply online”.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that’s what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: No
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Malgorzata Ewa Zalewska

Title: Back-end / Python Developer
Description:
Country

Spain

Job Family

Technology

At GfK, we are on a mission to drive sustainable growth for our people, our clients, and the world around us. We combine prescriptive insights and consulting expertise to analyze, explain and predict what is happening in today’s fast-changing world.

Our employees, the shapers of tomorrow, are empowered to bring new bold ideas to life by connecting unique datasets, science, and digital research. We encourage innovation and offer global career and fast development opportunities. This is why the world’s largest companies and leading brands know GfK as their trusted partner.

Job Description

At netquest we are looking for an experienced Back-end / Python Developer to join our team in the beautiful Barcelona/Spain. We are looking for someone willing to take the challenge to help us build our product suite around our tracking technology.

Responsibilities

Understanding and maintaining the product's backend infrastructure.
Help to design our new architecture and technology
Create and maintain unit test cases
Create containerized images with docker
Refine User Stories
Document either on the code or at the project level
Attend and participate in SCRUM ceremonies
Collaborate with our Android, iOS, and Desktop developer to integrate our mobile applications.

Requirements

3-5 years of experience in backend development
Working experience with Python
Experience working with medium-large applications and building frameworks
Understanding REST principles
Design Patterns (work with detailed Pull Requests and Reviews)
Worked with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
Python (AWS boto3, PEP8)
AWS (Athena, Lambdas, S3, CloudWatch, SQS, SNS)
Docker Jenkins, Codeship, Codebuild
Swagger

How We Work

Hybrid model: 2 days in our Office and 3 days from home
For this position we work in a 4 +1 environment: From Monday to Thursday normal working days, Fridays will be dedicated to your development.

Join our team and shape your career to the next level!

Don't meet every single requirement? Some people are less likely to apply unless they meet all the requirements listed in a job specification. GfK is looking for self-starters to join our innovative team keen to take on a new challenge. So, if you're excited about this role but your skills and experience don't align perfectly with every requirement we've listed, we still encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal opportunity in employment which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential. We are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Solutions Engineer
Description:
Únete a nuestro equipo como




Solutions Engineer




ESP-Mataró (Barcelona)




Aprovecha la nueva oportunidad que te ofrece HARTMANN en el Área de Soluciones.




Responsabilidades




Como Solutions Engineer asumirás las siguientes responsabilidades:




Project management de implementación de soluciones locales e internacionales con foco en el desarrollo técnico de la solución.
Aportar valor, soporte técnico y seguimiento en proyectos en fase test, piloto y arranques tanto locales como internacionales.
Insight de mercado e ideación para identificar nuevas necesidades de clientes.
Soporte a cliente de las soluciones implementadas.
Seguimiento implementaciones a clientes durante su ciclo de vida, con revisión del cumplimiento de indicadores de servicio y funcionamiento frente a objetivos (productividades, costes, niveles de servicio, tiempo de reacción, etc.)
Forecast de soluciones, gestión de compras y control de inventarios
Gestión incidencias técnicas
Soporte en negociación con los proveedores y en la planificación de las operaciones.
Definición y mejora de los procesos de Servicio de Asistencia Técnica
Aporte de valor en la mejora continua de soluciones y sistemas de gestión




¿Qué estamos buscando?




3 a 5 años de experiencia contrastada con plataformas internas y externas en el área de operaciones y coordinación de servicios de atención al cliente.
Título universitario de Ingeniería Industrial, Ingeniería en Organización Industrial, Ingeniería Biomédica o ADE. Se valorarán estudios de máster
Nivel de inglés alto (Advanced)




¿Estás preparado para formar parte de una compañía internacional con un posicionamiento clave en el mercado? Entonces anímate a seguir con tu carrera profesional en HARTMANN.




Nuestro mayor potencial es invertir en el desarrollo de nuestros colaboradores.




Departamento: Operaciones




Si estás interesado/a en la posición por favor es imprescindible que te registres previamente y nos hagas llegar tu CV a través de la opción de “Enviar Candidatura Ahora” que aparece más abajo.




Una vez registrado/a, podrás hacer llegar cualquier consulta sobre el perfil solicitado a Agostina Camarotti.




Correo electrónico: Agostina.Camarotti@hartmann.info

HTML:
Únete a nuestro equipo como


Solutions Engineer


ESP-Mataró (Barcelona)


Aprovecha la nueva oportunidad que te ofrece HARTMANN en el Área de Soluciones.


Responsabilidades


Como Solutions Engineer asumirás las siguientes responsabilidades:


  • Project management de implementación de soluciones locales e internacionales con foco en el desarrollo técnico de la solución.
  • Aportar valor, soporte técnico y seguimiento en proyectos en fase test, piloto y arranques tanto locales como internacionales.
  • Insight de mercado e ideación para identificar nuevas necesidades de clientes.
  • Soporte a cliente de las soluciones implementadas.
  • Seguimiento implementaciones a clientes durante su ciclo de vida, con revisión del cumplimiento de indicadores de servicio y funcionamiento frente a objetivos (productividades, costes, niveles de servicio, tiempo de reacción, etc.)
  • Forecast de soluciones, gestión de compras y control de inventarios
  • Gestión incidencias técnicas
  • Soporte en negociación con los proveedores y en la planificación de las operaciones.
  • Definición y mejora de los procesos de Servicio de Asistencia Técnica
  • Aporte de valor en la mejora continua de soluciones y sistemas de gestión


¿Qué estamos buscando?


  • 3 a 5 años de experiencia contrastada con plataformas internas y externas en el área de operaciones y coordinación de servicios de atención al cliente.
  • Título universitario de Ingeniería Industrial, Ingeniería en Organización Industrial, Ingeniería Biomédica o ADE. Se valorarán estudios de máster
  • Nivel de inglés alto (Advanced)

Title: Principal/Sr Clinical Data Scientist
Description:
Description

Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives.

Our Clinical Development model brings the customer and the patient to the center of everything that we do. We are continuously looking for ways to simplify and streamline our work to not only make Syneos Health easier to work with, but to make us easier to work for.

Whether you join us in a Functional Service Provider partnership or a Full-Service environment, you’ll collaborate with passionate problem solvers, innovating as a team to help our customers achieve their goals. We are agile and driven to accelerate the delivery of therapies, because we are passionate to change lives.

Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know:

WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE

Why Syneos Health

We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.

Job details

Responsible for the end-to-end coordination of cross functional data collection and cleaning activities to ensure clinical study data deliverables are fit for purpose and align with the executed contract and sponsor expectations and timelines.

Job Responsibilities

Serves as Functional Lead for Clinical Data Science including primary contact for internal liaison between Clinical Data Science and Project Management, Clinical Monitoring, and other functional groups
Acts as central steward of clinical data quality, monitors risks through the holistic review of clinical and operational data, using high level knowledge of the protocol, taking into account the specific therapeutic area aspects of the protocol related to the data collected and aligning with cross functional operational plans to drive comprehensive clinical data quality
Ensures the required data elements and corresponding data quality oversight steps are identified to support the defined study analysis
Works with assigned project teams to communicate, address, troubleshoot and resolve data related questions and recommends potential solutions; escalates issues which potentially impact patient safety and study analysis
Coordinates cross functional data cleaning activities to ensure quality standards and timelines are met for clinical data deliverables Ensures the required data elements and corresponding data quality oversight steps are identified to support the defined project analysis
Drives the development of the clinical data acquisition plan and corresponding data flow diagram with the study team, assess risks associated with protocol design, study set parameters that could impact the credibility and reliability of the trial results, aligns data flow with the study protocol to ensure data collected meets regulatory and study endpoint requirements.
Drives the development of analytical tools, utilizes analytical platform/dashboard to detect potentially unreliable data that may impact the validity of the trial results Performs analytic reviews as defined in scope of work and data acquisition plan, identifies root cause to systematically resolve data issues
Monitors and communicates project progress to the Sponsor and project team including use of project status reports and tracking tools/metrics
Ensures launch, delivery and completion of all Clinical Data Sciences activities and milestones according to contractual agreement and relevant Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), guidelines, and regulations
Review, maintain budget and identify out of scope for Clinical Sciences activities, raise to PM to be implemented in required change order
Plans, manages, and requests Clinical Data Science resources for assigned projects
Coordinates the work of the assigned Clinical Data Science team
Develops and maintains project plans, specifications, and documentation in line with SOP requirements
Maintains documentation on an ongoing basis and ensures that all TMF filing is up to date for necessary files
Participates in, and presents at internal, Sponsor, third-party, and investigator meetings on behalf of clinical data science responsibilities
Prepares input, and participates in proposal bid defense meetings and request for proposals on behalf of clinical data science responsibilities
Plans for and creates necessary documentation to support internal and external audits; participates in such audits on behalf of clinical data sciences responsibilities
Trains and mentors new or junior team members
Maintains proficiency in Clinical Data Science systems and processes through regular training. May attend/represent the company at professional meetings/conferences
Performs other work-related duties as assigned. Minimal travel may be required (up to 25%)

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will need the following experience / skills to be considered:

BA/BS in the biological sciences, computer sciences, mathematics, or data sciences and/or related disciplines in the natural science/health care space. MS degree is preferred. In lieu of degree, equivalent relevant work experience
Clinical Data Science experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience in Clinical Data Science practices and relational database management software systems
Strong knowledge of the drug development process and its impact on data quality, in particular riskbased approach, biometrics procedures, workflows.
Aptitude for understanding analytic modeling methods such as regression, classification and clustering
Strong project management skills and knowledge of project management methodologies
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of Artificial intelligence /machine learning methodologies preferred
Demonstrated staff leadership skills
Knowledge of ALCOA++ data quality principles
Strong experience with protocol interpretation, data collection and data cleaning specification development
Experienced with data analysis/data review and visualization tool sets including but not limited to Python, R, Spotfire, SAS
Knowledge of medical terminology, clinical data, and ICH/GCP regulatory requirements for clinical studies, in particular requirements applicable to Clinical Data Sciences
Proficiency in MS Windows navigation, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and email applications
Effective oral and written communication and presentation skills
Good organizational, planning, and time management skills with the ability to multitask under tight deadlines while providing attention to detail
Ability to be flexible and adapt to change, to work independently, as well as part of a multi-disciplinary team
Ability to make effective decisions and manage multiple priorities in a highly dynamic environment

Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health.

Additional Information

Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health.

Title: React developer - Up to 80K
Description:
About GFT Group

As a pioneer for digital transformation, GFT develops sustainable solutions across new technologies – from cloud engineering and artificial intelligence to blockchain/DLT.

With its deep technological expertise, strong partnerships and comprehensive market know-how GFT offers advice to the financial and insurance sectors, as well as in the manufacturing industry. Through the intelligent use of IT solutions GFT increases productivity and creates added value for clients.

Companies gain easy and safe access to scalable IT-applications and innovative business models. Founded in 1987 and located in more than 15 markets to ensure proximity to clients, the GFT team consists of over 10,000 determined talents. GFT provides them with career opportunities in all areas of software engineering and innovation.




Your mission 👀

• Development of web applications with the latest versions of the main frameworks and libraries based on requirements and detailed specifications.

• Development of web apps from scratch using latest version of forementioned frameworks/libraries.

• Understanding and applying common design patterns.

• Support the development of prototype versions of software modules and applications.

• Report on the progress made in the assigned tasks, achieving defined deadlines.

• Identify and communicate opportunities for improvement.

• Collaborate on projects based on Agile methodologies.

• Testing to ensure code quality.

• Performs project related “on-call” support activities if needed.

• Understanding of the "rules of development" (Code management, code repository, continuous Integration – CI and code review).




What they expect from you 🏅

• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript: Must have a solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript,

• Expert Knowledge of React: A deep understanding of the specific framework they work with, including its syntax, features, and best practices.

• Experience with state management: Should be proficient in managing the state of their application using state management libraries like Redux, NgRx, or MobX.

• Understanding of component-based architecture: A strong understanding of how to design, create use and and optimize components effectively.

• Familiarity with UI design patterns: Familiar with commonly used UI design patterns and know how to implement them in their applications.

• Understanding of responsive design: Must have a solid understanding of responsive design principles and be able to create responsive layouts that work well on different screen sizes.

• Knowledge of testing: Front-end developers should be proficient in testing their code using standard testing frameworks.

• Experience with version control: Proficient in using version control tools (Git) to manage code.




Benefits & perks 💎

Competitive salary.
Restaurant tickets and life insurance for every employee.
The possibility of Working from Home in a hybrid model. Office: 1 or 2 days per week.
Flexible compensation plan, according to your needs.
Customized plan for professional development and training program.
Technical certifications.
Subsidized English / German / Spanish courses.
Flexible working hours and short Fridays.
Program to improve and promote a healthy lifestyle at work: a sports program and fresh fruit in the offices.
International work culture.
Discount with Gympass
Show more Show less

Title: GNSS Engineer for SOUTHPAN project
Description:
We lead missions to outer planets, observe the Earth from space, bring technology to Mars, integrate aerospace technology into people's daily lives... We dreamed about touching the stars, and we did it! If you don't know us yet, we are an engineering and technological innovation company working on several areas, including the space sector, where we lead projects in flight segment activities, satellite navigation, ground segment, data processing or space robotics among many others.




You will be part of our team, full of talent and desire to innovate, where you will:




Definition of new subsystems to be developed, including navigation algorithms
Maintenances of current subsystems already under operations analysising anomalies reported by the customer
Experimentation and testing
Documentation and customer support
Attedance to meetings with customer
Participation on RDI projects related to SBAS and A-RAIM systems




DO YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM?




If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following knowledge/experience:




Software design and development
Algorithm development
Fluent in English (C1 or higher)
Programming in C
Linux (Unix) environment
Matlab/Octave
GNSS knowledge




WHAT DO WE OFFER?




Join our team and culture GMV by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
Professional career development and training plan. You will be able to acquire or perfect knowledge in the technologies we use as well as in skills. We also offer a language learning program.
We are flexible! We have flexible hours and intensive working hours during the summer months. In addition, you can work from home to improve your work-life balance.
We care about your well-being. You will have private health insurance with dental and accident insurance.
You will be able to make part of your salary more flexible through our flexible salary plan where you will have several options such as restaurant tickets, childcare tickets, medical insurance for a family member.…
Join our team activities, events and sports competitions. In addition, we offer Gympass to keep you active.
No dress code! Be comfortable at work
Are you coming from another country? We offer you a relocation package.
Do you want to switch off? You will find fruit and coffee at your disposal in our dining rooms.




WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?




If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact Anna Alejo Guilarte, in charge of this vacancy.




Anna Alejo Guilarte

Title: Front End Developer (React Native, iOS/Android)
Description:
Your Role

As a front-end engineer, you will be tasked with leading the technical design and implementation of our platform app for iOS & Android. You will be given the opportunity to be an active contributor to product decision-making, work side by side with the founders, and will have a crucial impact on the end-user experience.

Experience

+3 years of experience building and using components and design systems for iOS/Android applications.
Can craft joyous user experiences (including animations) and reusable components using React Native, ably backed up by a solid understanding of JavaScript and TypeScript.
Good knowledge and understanding of modern web technologies, specifically GraphQL, Golang, Node.js, REST, HTTP basics, and gRPC.
Collaborate in Figma for design purposes (UX/UI will be provided).
Demonstrated experience working on mobile applications.

Ideal Candidates

Have experience with financial product companies and an interest in financial products and markets.
Eager to learn more about the creator economy"
A GitHub account/portfolio with some mobile application projects on it.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer at TheWiseSeeker
Description:
Empresa líder mundial en soluciones publicitarias, mediáticas y ad-tech, busca incorporar a su plantilla a un/una Senior Machine Learning Engineer.

Tareas

Estarás profundamente involucrado en todas las decisiones importantes de arquitectura y desarrollo que tomemos sobre nuestros algoritmos.
Serás responsable del desarrollo de nuevas funcionalidades, midiendo el rendimiento y mejorando los pipelines.
Desempeñarás un papel analítico investigando, diseñando, implementando y desplegando soluciones de aprendizaje automático y análisis de datos escalables de pila completa para resolver problemas empresariales, además de trabajar estrechamente con el equipo técnico y de operaciones.
Trabajarás en desafíos de modelado únicos no cubiertos en la literatura científica, como la escasez de muestras positivas extremas y el retraso en el etiquetado.
Analizarás datos de diferentes fuentes y proporcionarás información práctica a las partes interesadas del negocio y de ingeniería.


Requisitos

Más de 3 años de experiencia en puestos relacionados con la ciencia de datos.
Gran capacidad de codificación: Python, Scala, Java.
Competencia en la creación de algoritmos de alto rendimiento en producción.
Capacidad para resolver problemas.
Conocimiento de técnicas y conceptos estadísticos avanzados (regresión, propiedades de las distribuciones, pruebas de significación estadística).
Experiencia en minería de datos y modelización predictiva, incluyendo modelos de regresión logística, clustering y análisis de series temporales.
Conocimiento de herramientas de versiones Bitbucket/Git.
Experiencia de trabajo con SQL y almacenamiento de datos.
Posee excelentes habilidades de comunicación tanto verbal como escrita.
Capaz de orientar a otros miembros del equipo.
Dominio del inglés


Beneficios

Ubicación: Barcelona
Modalidad de trabajo: Híbrido (2 días de teletrabajo, 3 días presenciales).
Salario: 60K
Flexibilidad horaria
Oportunidades de aprendizaje y formación.
Vales de comida - Tickets Restaurante asignación mensual.
Subsidio mensual de gimnasio para utilizar hasta en los 30 gimnasios DIR de la ciudad.
Eventos TGIF mensuales.
Eventos regulares para fomentar el espíritu de equipo.
Entorno de trabajo divertido y agradable con profesionales del marketing e ingenieros con talento de más de 21 países.
Exposición a los principales editores de aplicaciones globales (Zynga, King, Rovio, EA, etc.) y socios de medios en la industria de la publicidad digital.

Integración, puesta en marcha y reforma de equipos con autómatas programables
Relación con sistemas PLC y HDMI (Human Machine Interface)
Relación con pantallas SIEMENS y OMRON, ROCWELL
Dibujo técnico con ePlan

Jornada partida de lunes a viernes
Salario según valía del candidato

Title: Desarrollador/a de Software I+D
Description:
En Capgemini Engineering, líder global en servicios de consultoría, transformación digital, tecnología e ingeniería buscamos personas como tú!




Desde I+D Automoción buscamos que seas parte de nuestro equipo y puedas aportar tu talento a un proyecto de autonomous shuttle, donde algunas de tus actividades serán:




Definición de Requisitos
Desarrollo de interfaces
Configuración de una ECU basada en NVIDIA
Integración Servicios externos de CV en la ECU
Desarrollo Algoritmos de CV




¿Qué perfil buscamos?




Nivel Alto en lenguages de programación: C, C++, Python
Nivel escrito y oral alto de Ingles
Sistemas Operativos: Buen dominio de Linux, ROS/ROS2, RTOS
Conocimientos de arquitecturas GPUs NVIDIA, CUDA
Conocimientos sensores: Cámaras, Radar (Opcional), Lidar (Opcional)
Conocimienos Tools de IA y CV
Conocimientos protocolos de comunicación: Ethernet, CAN
Conocimientos sistemas ADAS automocion (Opcional)




Si No reúnes todas estas características, no te preocupes, ¡igualmente queremos conocerte!




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Te incorporarás a una empresa multinacional competitiva en continuo crecimiento, con presencia en más de 50 países en la que formarás parte de un equipo de profesionales cualificados.
Tendrás la oportunidad de seguir tu formación y crecer como profesional en un buen ambiente de trabajo, para ello tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación (técnica, habilidades personales e idiomas) según tu criterio y tus necesidades
Tendrás la oportunidad de crear tu plan de carrera y crecer como profesional.
Contarás con un gran paquete de beneficios sociales (club del empleado, plan de retribución flexible, etc..)




"Únete a Capgemini Engineering, Get the future you want"

Title: Full Stack Engineer (100% remote-friendly within Spain)
Description:
How would you be impacting our mission?





As a Full Stack Engineer, you will become a valuable member of the Integrations Team within our Integrations business domain. Your responsibilities will encompass both the design and implementation of solutions, while adhering to and promoting best practices in software analysis, design, and development.





As an Integrations Team, we focus on building APIs that our partners use to integrate with our healthcare products. We also create embeddable widgets that Clinics and Doctors use to boost their efficiency and experience without leaving the software of their choice. In this business domain, you will collaborate with fellow Engineers who are experts in Vue.js, Electron, .NET, and PHP.





Each team in the domain benefits from the guidance of a dedicated Product Manager and Team Leader. We employ modern product discovery techniques inspired by the works of Marty Cagan and Teresa Torres. In terms of workflow, we adopt the Shape Up methodology and empower our engineering teams with a high degree of autonomy. The current team size stands at six members.





In this role, your primary focus will be on the frontend aspects of the widgets, developed using Vue.js and our custom UI Kit. Occasionally, you may also collaborate with colleagues on PHP-related tasks during pair programming sessions to further enhance your skill set and contribute to the team's success.





Qualifications



What will help you thrive?



You have 4+ years of experience working on web applications.
You work with TypeScript and Vue.js.
You use tools like GIT, SASS, esbuild, Webpack, NPM.
You can work with PHP (Symfony) when it is needed.
You are familiar with Extreme Programming values, principles and techniques.
You feel comfortable working in a small team, owning processes, taking initiative and making decisions. We work in Shape Up!
You can communicate in English – both spoken and written - min. B2 level.
Growth mindset: nobody ticks all those boxes above, but willingness to learn is strongly valued here.

Bonus points:



You have experience working with UI Kit / Design System.
You have experience working with Docker.
You have experience with CI / CD, incremental work breakdown, feature flags and frequent deployments.
You have experience working in DevOps Culture.
You have basic knowledge of System Design and Architecture.

You’re an excellent fit for this role if:​​​​​​​



You are a person that has a constant desire to learn new things and share your knowledge with team members.
You have great attention to detail.
You are a great team player!







Additional Information



What will you get in return?





Let’s talk money



A salary adequate to your experience and skills between 44.000and 55.000EUR. The range is broad so that we can accommodate our roles for all levels of experience, but we will show you the career ladder to explain where we see your skills and impact within the company". Your salary will be, now and always, 100% transparent to you;
Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.





True flexibility and work-life balance



Remote or hybrid work model with our hub in Barcelona;
Flexible working hours (fully flexible, as in most cases you only have to be on a couple of meetings weekly);
Summer intensive schedule during July and August (work 7 hours, finish earlier);
23 paid holidays, with exchangeable local bank holidays;
Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).





Health comes first



Private healthcare plan with Adeslas for you and subsidized for your family (medical and dental);
Access to hundreds of gyms for a symbolic fee in partnership for you and your family with Andjoy;
Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.





Keep growing with us



20% time rule: spend 20% of your working hours on personal development related to your role and collaboration with other teams;;
Free English and Spanish classes.



Are you from abroad?



Relocation support to Spain (we handle the bureaucracy, so you don’t have to);



We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.



“We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Frontend Developer (Remote work is ok/Spain)
Description:
We’re looking for a Frontend Developer who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How Will You Make a Difference

Develop modern high-converting designs that utilize all the best marketing techniques
Program the frontend layer of our sites in HTML5, CSS3 and JS, taking into account standards, compatibility between browsers and mobile devices.
Design and develop the frontend layer of our own tools
Test across multiple browsers and devices to ensure maximum compatibility
Work with a heterogeneous team consisting of Product, Marketing, Design, QA and Operations
Perform regular code reviews with the team
Write reusable code and libraries


Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd

At least 3 years of work experience in front-end development
Proficient in HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, jQuery, and Git
Must be able to code from scratch in JavaScript such as ES6
Be familiar with CSS methodologies: OOCSS, BEM o SMACSS
Solid understanding of SASS
Desirable experience with Twig or another template engine for php
We highly appreciate experience with Typescript / React / Jamstacks (NextJS or Gatsby) / Unit testing with Jest / Styled Components / Storybook
Comfortable with package managers such as (Yarn, NPM, etc.)
Entrepreneurial spirit, inquisitive, analytical, self-driven, and self-motivated
Be highly flexible and proactive
Online business strategic mind
Advanced problem-solving skills
Coding and implementation using best practices to produce high performing/scalable/secured modules.
Fluent Spanish and Intermediate English speaking


Your team

We’re team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and that the team’s success is your success, then you’re one of us!

Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the office. That’s why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.

Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus.

Benefits

Perks of being one of us

Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas’ Eve and New Year’s Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 – 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 – 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you’ll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean


Sounds good? Apply now! We’re looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona’s Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you’ll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you’ll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
FIDES Electrónica es una empresa ubicada en Sant Cugat del Vallès y está especializada en el diseño, desarrollo y fabricación de electrónica para línea blanca
(electrodomésticos), dispositivos para el sector industrial y para motocicletas.
Actualmente la empresa está invirtiendo en la expansión del departamento de Ingeniería para atender el
incremento de volumen de proyectos. El departamento cubre todas las áreas de diseño requeridas por los proyectos (diseño esquema electrónico, layout PCB, software, validación, procesos de fabricación).
FIDES busca ingenier@s junior y senior de SW para el diseño y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos basados en microcontroladores, en modalidad de teletrabajo parcial.

Formación y conocimientos requeridos:

- Ingeniería Electrónica – Telecomunicaciones
- Inglés nivel B2-C1

Se valorarán conocimientos y experiencia de algunos de los siguientes ítems:
- Control de motores brushless e inducción
- Experiencia en control de displays TFT
- Functional Safety ISO 26262 / Clase B

Responsabilidades/tareas:

- Liderazgo del proyecto de Software del proyecto asignado
- Diseño y desarrollo de Software en lenguaje C para control de motores o para interficies gráficas
mediante TFT
- Definición y gestión de requisitos técnicos de los proyectos asignados
- Validación funcional de los productos desarrollados

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
En The Predictive Company, estamos en proceso de fortalecer nuestro equipo y nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil técnico con sólidos conocimientos en el área de informática y tecnologías de la información. 

 

Estamos en la búsqueda de un individuo altamente proactivo, responsable y resolutivo, capaz de aprender de manera autónoma y de desarrollar proyectos de manera independiente. La persona que buscamos debe sentirse motivada para liderar un proyecto prácticamente desde sus inicios y poseer el firme compromiso de realizar las tareas de forma óptima y con la mayor calidad posible. Además, valoramos su disposición para documentar el proceso con gran detalle y precisión, lo que permitirá garantizar la continuidad del proyecto a largo plazo. 

 

Si en este momento estás buscando un nuevo desafío en el área de informática y te interesa trabajar en el desarrollo de soluciones SaaS enfocadas en la eficiencia energética, esta es una oportunidad que no puedes dejar pasar. Somos una Start-up en plena fase de expansión y nos encantaría contar contigo para seguir creciendo y alcanzando nuestros objetivos. 

 




Tareas:




Automatización de procesos de adquisición de datos con Python mediante protocolos industriales (BACnet, OPC, Modbus, etc.). 
Creación y mantenimiento de bases de datos de series temporales (InfluxDB, AWS Timestream). 
Creación y administración de servidores (instancias EC2) en la nube de AWS  
soporte en la innovación y desarrollo de otros procesos involucrados en la solución. 
Gestión y organización de proyectos. 
Encargado de mantener relaciones con los equipos técnicos de los clientes.  




¿Qué ofecemos?




Flexibilidad en cuanto a horarios y política de trabajo remoto.  
Oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente. Podrás desarrollar nuevas habilidades y asumir nuevas responsabilidades. 
Integración en un equipo multidisciplinar. 
Disposición de medidas de conciliación de la vida personal y profesional. 




Requisitos:




Estudios mínimos: 

Cursando el último año/Graduado en Ingeniería o Máster en áreas de informática, industriales, telecomunicaciones o similar. 

FP Superior en informática con Experiencia Laboral. 




Valoramos positivamente: 

Nivel avanzado de programación en Python. 
Experiencia en administración de sistemas. 
Creación y mantenimiento de máquinas virtuales/servidores. 
Servicios en la nube AWS. 
Creación y gestión de bases de datos. 
Conocimientos o interés en eficiencia energética y sistemas de climatización. 
Familiaridad en el uso y diseño de contenedores Docker o soluciones similares.  
Familiaridad con procesos CI/CD y metodologías y herramientas devOps. 
Formación y/o experiencia en gestión de proyectos. 

Idiomas: 

Idiomas: inglés técnico (min B2) y castellano/catalán fluido. 




Show more Show less

Title: Staff ML Research Scientist
Description:
Overview:




Crisis Text Line provides free, 24/7, high-quality text-based mental health support and crisis intervention by empowering a community of trained volunteers to support people in their moments of need.




Our mission is at the intersection of empathy and innovation — we promote mental well-being for people wherever they are.




Our vision is an empathetic world where nobody feels alone.




Our core values are at the heart of all we do: connect with empathy, center equity, get it done together, and reflect and evolve.




Role




PLEASE NOTE WE ARE ONLY SEEKING CANDIDATES IN SPAIN OR COLOMBIA****




As a Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist within the Research & Impact team, you will lead foundational ML/AI efforts to deliver a consistent flow of high-quality, insightful research aimed at evidencing and optimizing impact of Crisis Text Line’s service and improving practice, policy and the broader field of mental health support in the US and globally.




You will use Natural Language Processing techniques and Machine Learning models to monitor emerging trends and identify novel signals in our conversations with people in pain so that we can generate near-real-time insights with a potential to improve the lives of people in crisis. As part of a small but nimble team working in collaboration with divisions across the organization, you will research a corpus of over 260 million text messages related to mental health crises to pursue impactful research questions, build ML models to identify new themes, deliver compelling data visualization and actionable insights to amplify Crisis Text Line’s impact for texters, volunteers, and society across languages, cultures, and contexts.




Reporting to the Senior Principal Research Scientist, you will research a unique dataset of more than 8 million crisis conversations since 2013. You will work in close collaboration with all members of the Research & Impact team, as well as with cross-functional partners in data analytics, clinical, volunteer experience, user research, engineering, and product teams. An individual contributor, you will work in close collaboration with all members of the Research & Impact team to ensure equity, diversity, inclusion, and intentional visibilization of multiple identities, especially historically minoritized groups, is an explicit focus for our work.




Responsibilities:




Crisis Text Line is a fast moving, growing organization with a big vision and a critical mission. To serve our mission and vision, each role must be agile and flexible to meet the needs of the business, aligning their work with priorities as defined by their manager and team leaders.




Lead Machine Learning to Deliver New Research Insights for Crisis Text Line




Surveil internal data in combination with external datasets in order to monitor and identify emerging issues and trends in our conversations with people in crisis
Design and evaluate ML/AI models and deploy NLP techniques to study topics like mental health stressors, risk, and coping strategies in Crisis Text Line data
Fully own model pipelines, from data collection and labeling, to deployment




Communicate Results & Support Data Storytelling




Communicate and share model performance and impact in a digestible way with the rest of the team and organization
Implement new data visualization techniques
Support efforts to communicate results for non-technical audiences, including ongoing management of organization-wide internal data insights and research requests as a member of the core workflow team




Lead ML/AI Documentation and Coding Practices on the Research and Impact Team




Implement industry standard documentation and coding protocols and practices on the Research and Impact team
Provide ML, NLP and coding expertise and core reviews across the Research and Impact portfolio, and corresponding mentorship of members of the team in their use of technological tools
Support the development or review of all external-facing content referencing Crisis Text Line data and insights, as appropriate




Functional/ Technical Skills




Qualifications:




6+ years of combined training and experience in computational social science, natural language processing, computer science, or related disciplines
Theoretical and practical understanding of ML/AI models both for structured and unstructured data
Proficiency in SQL and Python and the relevant ML libraries (Preferred: understanding of distributed computing frameworks e.g. Spark)
Ability to write clean and modular code and work with version control tools.
Strong understanding of NLP techniques (text parsing, lemmatization, tf-idf, topic modeling, etc.) and the associated ML/AI models
Skills in translating research results into non-technical insights for broad consumption




Salary Range: $126,000 - $178,000




This range is provided by Crisis Text Line. Your actual pay will be based on your skills, experience, location, and applicable law (such as local minimum wage laws). We pay competitively in the tech-forward nonprofit space and offer a robust benefits package.




Benefits:




Crisis Text Line employee benefits are thoughtfully designed using an equity lens, acknowledging that we are all unique human beings with individual life circumstances that require flexibility and support.




Benefits include:




20 paid holidays including:
Federal holidays like Juneteenth and Labor Day
Election day
Holiday break from Dec 24 through January 1
2 renewal days
2 floating holidays
Flexible paid time off, including:
15 vacation days
3 personal days
7 sick days
Medical, dental, and vision benefits for the staff member and family at no cost to the employee
403B retirement plan (the nonprofit equivalent of a 401K): 3% contribution by Crisis Text Line to support building financial wellness, regardless of personal contribution
12 weeks paid parental leave (after 6 months of employment)
Student loan repayment (after 2 years of continuous full time service)
Family support through a virtual childcare platform
Stipends/Allowances
Mental health (Monthly)
Internet Service (Monthly)
Professional Development (Annual)
Wellness (Annual)
Home office setup (One time/First year)




(Benefits only apply to full-time employees)




Crisis Text Line is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who have a disability and meet the skill, experience, education, and other job-related requirements of the role to allow the individual to perform the essential functions of the job.

Crisis Text Line employee benefits are thoughtfully designed using an equity lens, acknowledging that we are all unique human beings with individual life circumstances that require flexibility and support.


Benefits include:


  • 20 paid holidays including:
    • Federal holidays like Juneteenth and Labor Day
    • Election day
    • Holiday break from Dec 24 through January 1
    • 2 renewal days
    • 2 floating holidays

    • 15 vacation days

    • 7 sick days
  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits for the staff member and family at no cost to the employee
