Title: Data Engineer, Hardware
Description:
Company Description

Block is one company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment. The blocks that form our foundational teams — People, Finance, Counsel, Hardware, Information Security, Platform Infrastructure Engineering, and more — provide support and guidance at the corporate level. They work across business groups and around the globe, spanning time zones and disciplines to develop inclusive People policies, forecast finances, give legal counsel, safeguard systems, nurture new initiatives, and more. Every challenge creates possibilities, and we need different perspectives to see them all. Bring yours to Block.

Job Description

Block began with a simple yet revolutionary piece of hardware—the Square Reader. We have expanded that vision to give our merchants access to the latest secure payment technologies (contactless and chip cards) and easy-to-use Point of Sale products. Today our hardware carries over $30 billion in transactions annually. Measuring the performance of our hardware, and the journey in getting the hardware to our merchants, is essential in ensuring that our merchants’ experience with Square is as seamless as possible.

We need your help to collect data about our hardware, organize that data, and make it available to analysts across Block. As a member of the Hardware Data Engineering team, you will define, develop, and manage a variety of data infrastructure components and pipelines so that our analytics teams and collaborators have trusted data to inform decisions and insights.

You will:

Join the small but mighty Hardware Data Engineering team that partners with hardware data consumers to understand their needs and to source the right data sets to work on
Work in a remote environment that allows you to build scalable hardware data pipelines and tools to ingest data from internal/external sources to our cloud data stack (Snowflake / AWS)
Develop data structures to support flexible analysis of this data, including creating data models, structuring optimized ETLs, designing validation scripts
Develop platform infrastructure and data services/components to support data engineering automation and data quality initiatives
Troubleshoot technical issues with platforms, data discrepancies, alerts, etc
Be a voice between Block’s Hardware teams and Block's data community. Help the Hardware team’s data producers embrace best-practices, represent the Hardware team’s voice in data infrastructure planning discussions
Report into a Data Engineering Manager on the Data Lifecycle team within Foundational Engineering


Qualifications

Required:

5+ years building and supporting reporting data systems built on columnar oriented RDBMS systems (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Vertica, etc.)
Strong experience building data pipelines from heterogeneous data sources (e.g. Event streams, Flat Files, RDBMS, REST APIs, SFTP, etc.) to support real-time operational and analytical workloads
Technical accomplishments working with SQL, ETL, and Apache Airflow; and knowledge of at least one mature programming language (Ruby (and Rails), Python, Java, Go, or similar)
Experience with Linux/OSX command line, version control software (git), and general software development
Experience with cloud based data tools and services (e.g. AWS Lambda/S3/Transfer, GCP Cloud Functions/GCS, Fivetran, etc.)


Additional Information

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace.

Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.

Learn more about our efforts to promote inclusion and diversity at block.xyz/inclusion

Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

Perks

We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

Healthcare coverage
Retirement Plans
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Wellness perks
Paid parental leave
Paid time off
Learning and Development resources


Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.
Show more Show less

  • Work in a remote environment that allows you to build scalable hardware data pipelines and tools to ingest data from internal/external sources to our cloud data stack (Snowflake / AWS)
  • Develop data structures to support flexible analysis of this data, including creating data models, structuring optimized ETLs, designing validation scripts
  • Develop platform infrastructure and data services/components to support data engineering automation and data quality initiatives
  • Troubleshoot technical issues with platforms, data discrepancies, alerts, etc
  • Be a voice between Block’s Hardware teams and Block's data community. Help the Hardware team’s data producers embrace best-practices, represent the Hardware team’s voice in data infrastructure planning discussions
  • Report into a Data Engineering Manager on the Data Lifecycle team within Foundational Engineering

Qualifications

Required:
  • 5+ years building and supporting reporting data systems built on columnar oriented RDBMS systems (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Vertica, etc.)
  • Strong experience building data pipelines from heterogeneous data sources (e.g. Event streams, Flat Files, RDBMS, REST APIs, SFTP, etc.) to support real-time operational and analytical workloads
  • Technical accomplishments working with SQL, ETL, and Apache Airflow; and knowledge of at least one mature programming language (Ruby (and Rails), Python, Java, Go, or similar)
  • Experience with Linux/OSX command line, version control software (git), and general software development
  • Experience with cloud based data tools and services (e.g. AWS Lambda/S3/Transfer, GCP Cloud Functions/GCS, Fivetran, etc.)

Additional Information

We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace.

Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.

Learn more about our efforts to promote inclusion and diversity at block.xyz/inclusion

Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.

Perks

We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:
  • Healthcare coverage
  • Retirement Plans
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program
  • Wellness perks
  • Paid parental leave
  • Paid time off
  • Learning and Development resources

Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Title: DevOp Engineer
Description:
What is Later?

Later is the leading social media marketing and commerce platform that helps small business owners and creators grow their brands and businesses online. With a unique combination of tools, machine-learning-based recommendations, and education, Later makes it easy to visually plan & schedule social content, drive traffic, and increase sales – empowering customers to turn their passions into possibilities.

Later started at a hackathon in late 2013. Six months later, “Latergramme” launched to almost 20,000 people waiting to use the first version. Later is now the leading visual marketing platform for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok, and Pinterest in the world with over seven million users, and in 2021 was ranked #18 in Canada in Deloitte's Fast 50 list, #119 in North America, and placed 51st in the Globe and Mail's Fastest Growing Companies list.

Later & Mavrck

In March 2022, Later was acquired by Boston-based influencer marketing platform Mavrck. The Mavrck platform allows large enterprise brands to automate their influencer marketing strategy for smoother partnerships and performance on campaigns. Together, we’re helping connect creators & marketers together to grow their social followings and businesses on social media.

We are currently looking for a passionate DevOps Engineer to join our skilled Production Engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing high-quality, scalable, and resilient infrastructure that enables the rest of the engineering team to reliably deliver value to our customers.

Reporting to our Software Engineering Manager, this position offers the flexibility of a hybrid work model that combines remote and in-office collaboration.

What you will be doing:

As a DevOps Engineer at Later, you will play a crucial role in implementing infrastructure as code and GitOps practices to ensure efficient and reliable infrastructure management. You will work closely with our engineering teams, including backend, frontend, and mobile teams, to optimize our technology and processes, share your knowledge and experiences, and improve our capabilities.

At Later engineering, we are particularly keen on the following:

Collaboration: You will work closely with different teams to ensure the successful delivery of our roadmap. You will educate product and stakeholders on the trade-offs of different paths to a given milestone, enabling them to make informed decisions.
Continuous learning: You will be given dedicated unstructured dev time to stay up-to-date with new technologies, write technical blog articles, create internal tools, and make open-source contributions.
High coding standards: You will hold other developers to high coding standards through PR reviews.
Ownership: You will take ownership of pieces of code, infrastructure, and processes and continuously work to improve them.
Scalability: You will know how to scale workloads while managing the various resources used by them.


In this role, your responsibilities will include:

Implementing IaC and GitOps practices for change management and site reliability
Owning and improving deployment processes for our different apps and services
Supporting CI/CD pipelines for the various development teams
Maintaining documentation and runbooks for the services and infrastructure
Owning and scheduling maintenance for dependencies, databases and cache stores
Owning and improving infrastructure monitoring and alarming
Improving and optimizing the use of our AWS infrastructure
Automating common tasks to streamline processes and improve efficiency
Participating in the on-call rotation


Our tech stack

A moderately sized Ruby on Rails monolith
Dockerized services written in Node, Ruby, and Elixir
Node/Express/Typescript API
Postgres, Redis, and DynamoDB datastores
Infrastructure on top of AWS (ECS, EKS, and Lambda)
CI/CD pipeline with CircleCI and ArgoCD


We are committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career. If you identify with any of the following, we encourage you to apply!

3+ years of experience shipping code and services in production environments
Minimum 2+ years devops experience
Strong experience supporting AWS based deployments, K8s preferred
Experience working with service-oriented setup
Experience with infrastructure-as-code
Experience CI/CD pipelines across multiple domains
Familiarity with Postgres (or other relational DBs)
Familiarity with cloud based security best practices
Familiarity with Agile process


Nice to haves

We believe that good devops people have the ability to pick up new processes and technologies quickly, but some of the following will help you hit the ground running in one area or another.

Ruby on Rails applications
Typescript/Express applications
Elixir services
Docker and Kubernetes deployments
AWS based DevSecOps
Terraform


Our values

Lead with Humility: We put what’s best for all ahead of what’s best for one - no big egos here.
Adapt + Grow: We view uncertainty as opportunity and nimbly adapt.
Make it Happen: We have big ambitions and the courage to achieve them.
Succeed Together: We prioritize diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment - there’s a seat for everyone here.
Celebrate: We bring an optimistic mindset into everything we do. We celebrate progress, each other, and unique perspectives.


Some perks of being on our team include...

We are passionate about learning and development, providing opportunities through lunch and learns, training and workshops. We also provide each employee with a $3000 per year Education & Conference budget.
We provide our employees with a monthly Wellness Spending Account, to help cover costs related to fitness equipment, personal training, gym memberships, or health and wellness practitioners.
We provide our team with a generous technology bonus and provide the tools you need to succeed in your role.
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, vision, and an Employee and Family Assistance Program to support the wellbeing of you and your family.
We offer flexible working hours & schedules so you can work around school and home commitments.
We offer parental leave top-ups, family forming support, and a life-transitions program to ensure you and your family are well supported when returning to work
We provide a variety of workshops, meditation, and yoga at our monthly Wellness Wednesday events to help our team perform at their best.
All departments have quarterly department team building activities


Where we work

Later is proudly founded and based in Vancouver. Our team can work remotely from one of our hub city locations: Vancouver, Toronto, or London UK. We post our positions in the hub location that we are looking to hire for that role. Mavrck is based in Boston, MA.

Diversity, inclusion, and accessibility

Later values diversity of thought; we are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or age. Please let us know if you require any accommodations or support during the recruitment process.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

23WD69073

Position Overview

Autodesk’s Entertainment and Media Solutions (EMS) group is redefining the future of entertainment. We empower content makers to inspire, educate, and entertain, while investing in our employees to build a meaningful career with us. Autodesk is uniquely able to offer platforms, community, resources, best in class tools, and processes that unlock the future of productivity and creativity in media and entertainment.

We are looking for an results-oriented Software Developer to work alongside the talented engineering, QA, experience design, and content design teams responsible for creating new workflows for Forge in the Media and Entertainment space - Autodesk's cloud platform. You will coordinate with other developers, integrate with existing infrastructure and design new platform-enabled tools.

This is your chance to work for an amazing company and to help define the future of entertainment! We offer: a great work-life culture where different perspectives are celebrated, generous compensation (e.g., RRSP matching, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Fitness subsidy, etc.), and amazing spaces to get stuff done. Come be part of the #autodesklife.

Responsibilities

Interface with existing platform tools
Create robust modular, scalable, testable, tested, performant sub systems
Design and develop, performant components and APIs using GraphQL and/or REST
Refactor legacy code as required
Provide leadership and mentoring for full-stack teams
Promote coding best-practices, unit-testing
Produce both unit tests and developer documentation
Participate in and/or lead architecture and code reviews
Promote continuous improvement by identifying process
Lead or participate in other projects or duties as assigned
Review functional requirements, analysis, and design documents
Interact with external teams to jointly solve complex platform problems

Minimum Qualifications

Advanced fullstack coding skills (React/Redux, TypeScript, Apollo and related ecosystem)
Experience with microservice architectural design patterns and implementation (message queues, asynchronous and even-driven design, containers, distributed processing)
Demonstrable experience developing server-side APIs with GraphQL
Familiar with coding standards and unit-testing frameworks
Solid understanding of one or more database technologies (Postgres, Cassandra, etc)
Knowledge of source control systems such as Git and Subversion
Good verbal and written communication abilities
Team player attitude
Demonstrated agility and able to work within geographically dispersed teams

Preferred Qualifications

Development experience with platform technologies such as AWS
Python, C++, Java
ShotGrid/Toolkit APIs
Knowledge of ORMs (Django, Rails, etc)
Cross-platform development experience (Windows, Linux, OS X)

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers.

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.



With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Title: Front-end Developer
Description:
Description

Developers on our team have a commitment to collaborative problem solving, delivering quality products, and taking ownership of their projects. Evolving Web is looking for creative, experienced front-end developers who love to work in a collaborative environment with a stellar team of developers and designers. We are recruiting experienced developers in intermediate and senior positions.

We encourage you to apply if you’re planning on immigrating to Canada. We actively sponsor visa applications for qualified candidates and help them relocate to Montreal.

In your role as Front-end Developer, you will be expected to:

Work with a team of web developers, designers, and project managers
Use frameworks like React, Vue.js, or Angular to create decoupled front-end interfaces
Develop custom Drupal and WordPress themes
Advise on front-end best practices for innovative and interactive features
Implement front-end libraries and frameworks
Contribute to and participate in the technical community
Create documentation and blog posts
Make suggestions to improve design consistency and user experience

Requirements

What kind of skills set do you need to be successful in your role within the Evolving Web community:

Experience working with a CMS or web development platform
Experience using SASS, JavaScript and jQuery
Demonstrated experience using Javascript frameworks or libraries like React, Vue.js, Angular or Bootstrap
Experience working with a team using a standardized development workflow
Strong-sense of UX and web usability best practices
Understanding of software development practices
Familiarity with git
Experience working with APIs
Experience using a project management tool like Redmine or JIRA
Strong communication skills in English

Bonus For

Experience with Drupal theming
Experience using Gatsby, Node.js, Vue.js, Angular, React Native, etc.
Familiarity with the Linux command line
Strong communications skills in French

What kind of person usually gets along easily with us?

Collaborative and open to feedback
Love sharing what you know
Organized and able to work on several projects concurrently
Creative, curious, and proactive at problem solving
Not afraid of learning new tools and taking on new responsibilities

Benefits

What you get:

An environment that encourages continuous learning and mentorship
A team that’s big enough that you get to work on creative, meaningful projects and small enough that you can take ownership of your work
A collaborative, fun, and friendly environment where your input is highly valued
Competitive salary, a health insurance package, and a good work-life balance
Collaborations with organizations such as Princeton University, the Government of Canada
Diverse, multilingual team members from around the world
Remote-friendly workplace, with a beautiful office in Old Montreal

Title: DeFi Engineer - Rust & Solidity [Remote]
Description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $25 – $55/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 20h/week - Short term


THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements

Role

In this role you’ll have the opportunity to join an early stage company operating in programmatic trading and AI-powered investment strategies. Join a fast moving and fast growing company that acknowledges bold new ideas and rewards people who make those ideas a successful reality.

Qualifications

A successful candidate should have some (not all) of these specializations:

Deep understanding of blockchain fundamentals, protocol design and decentralized finance
1+ years of experience working with Rust
At least one project experience working with smart contracts, especially an EVM chain
Strong interest and willingness to learn about, or prior knowledge of algorithmic trading, arbitrage, yield farming, market making, high frequency trading
2+ years of experience working with REST APIs, websockets, JSON, and/or trading data integration
Strong applied programming skills with a demonstrated ability to write secure and high quality code
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Comfortable working with GCP, Git, Docker
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and successfully drive projects to production
Experience with data visualization tools
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good communication skills, data-oriented, and startup-minded personality.
What you’ll be working on

Overview

Fast growing crypto hedge fund startup seeking DeFi Software Engineer with Rust experience and advanced analytical skills (typically evidenced by a degree in math, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.), and a deep understanding of decentralized finance and blockchain. Our client highly value an entrepreneurial mindset and a determination that any problem can be solved no matter how complex/challenging the issue.

You will work closely with the founding team on the most important and challenging parts of the business and you will own your own areas related to their DeFi code base from day one. There will be plenty of opportunity to proactively shape your role, while driving real change and lasting impact for the company.

Company

Our client is a revolutionary asset management company. With technology in their DNA, they use innovative software models and proprietary strategies to create a market edge for their client investors.

Responsibilities

Improve and maintain an existing app stack which entails working on a full arbitrage engine (written in Rust) and contract (written in Solidity) that can be used to trade on pools deployed on EVM chains.
Integrating with DeFi protocols, blockchains and exchanges using latest gen APIs and smart contract architecture
Analyze on-chain data and activity and develop internal analytical tooling to produce new insights and actionable data analysis on blockchain activity
Design and implement new smart contract integrations to take on-chain actions within their larger trading strategy and infrastructure
Design and develop off-chain internal applications that operate within their existing trading structure via price oracles and exchange APIs
Any other relevant responsibility that may arise from time to time.


Apply Now!

Braintrust Job ID: 6382

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.

  • HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $25 – $55/hr

Requirements

Role

In this role you’ll have the opportunity to join an early stage company operating in programmatic trading and AI-powered investment strategies. Join a fast moving and fast growing company that acknowledges bold new ideas and rewards people who make those ideas a successful reality.

Qualifications

A successful candidate should have some (not all) of these specializations:
  • Deep understanding of blockchain fundamentals, protocol design and decentralized finance
  • 1+ years of experience working with Rust
  • At least one project experience working with smart contracts, especially an EVM chain
  • Strong interest and willingness to learn about, or prior knowledge of algorithmic trading, arbitrage, yield farming, market making, high frequency trading
  • 2+ years of experience working with REST APIs, websockets, JSON, and/or trading data integration
  • Strong applied programming skills with a demonstrated ability to write secure and high quality code
  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills
  • Comfortable working with GCP, Git, Docker
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and successfully drive projects to production
  • Experience with data visualization tools
  • Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
  • Good communication skills, data-oriented, and startup-minded personality.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Shakudo, we are transforming the way data-driven organizations develop, scale, deploy, and maintain their data stack. Our end-to-end data platform offers ever-evolving, fully managed, best-of-breed open-source components tailored to each business's unique needs, eliminating operational overhead and reducing costs.




We are looking for a talented Data Engineer with a passion for product evangelism to join our team. In this highly technical role, you will work closely with existing and potential customers' data and AI teams to help them understand and realize the value of our platform. You will also be responsible for developer relations, creating documentation, tutorials, and demos to promote our platform, as well as writing blogs, engaging with the right audience on social media, and presenting at conferences and events.




Responsibilities:

Assist sales teams in understanding customers' technical requirements and effectively communicate the benefits and features of the Shakudo platform
Develop strong relationships with customers and become their trusted technical advisor
Deliver product presentations and technical demos to customers and at industry events
Create and maintain technical documentation, tutorials, and demos to educate and engage our user community
Write engaging blog posts and social media content to promote our platform and foster engagement with the right audience
Present at conferences, webinars, and other events to showcase our platform and drive awareness
Collaborate with product management and engineering teams to provide customer feedback and insights
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and developments in data tooling
Provide pre-sales technical support to the sales team, ensuring smooth onboarding of new customers
Work closely with customer success teams to ensure customer satisfaction and address any technical issues




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Proficient in Python and strong background in data engineering, machine learning and distributed computing
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to new technologies quickly
Strong technical background in data engineering and cloud infrastructure, such as Snowflake, DBT, Apache Spark and Airflow
Excellent communication, presentation, and relationship-building skills
Experience with documentation and content creation for technical audiences
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Passion for product evangelism and building strong developer communities
Proven track record of creating engaging blog posts and social media content for technical audiences
Desired years of experience: 5-7







Shakudo is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates of all backgrounds to apply. If you are a skilled Sales Engineer with a deep understanding of the data tooling landscape and a passion for product evangelism, we would love to hear from candidates like you. Apply today to join our growing team and help us shape the future of data-driven products.

Title: Intern - Data Engineer
Description:
Summer Internship - Data Engineer

Location: Leamington, ON or Toronto, ON

Full-time. Paid Internship

Duration: 15 weeks, May - August 2023




ABOUT TILRAY

Tilray is a leading global cannabis-lifestyle and consumer packaged goods company with operations in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia, and Latin America that is changing people's lives for the better – one person at a time – by inspiring and empowering the worldwide community to live their very best life by providing them with products that meet the needs of their mind, body, and soul and invoke a sense of wellbeing. Tilray’s mission is to be the trusted partner for its patients and consumers by providing them with a cultivated experience and health and wellbeing through high-quality, differentiated brands and innovative products. A pioneer in cannabis research, cultivation, and distribution, Tilray’s unprecedented production platform supports over 20 brands in over 20 countries, including comprehensive cannabis offerings, hemp-based foods, and alcoholic beverages.




Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry?




JOB SUMMARY:

The Data Services Intern is responsible for preparing and cleansing data for analytics and machine learning operations around the company, while maintaining standards for accuracy and scalability required for a large global company.

As a candidate for this role, you are passionate about learning new technologies, and implementing systems which unlock data for various stakeholders around the business. You are a self-starter but enjoy collaborating within a communicative and enthusiastic technical team. You also are personable and able to engage non-technical stakeholders with exciting technical solutions.




ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist in the deployment of ETL and ELT data pipelines in an Azure environment
Build and design Data Warehouse tables which fit stakeholder needs in a computationally efficient manner
Quickly troubleshoot and remediate errors due to source data changes
Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements, and translate their needs into concrete, technically-sound solutions
Properly document and outline changes for an enterprise IT environment
Coding complex transformations using programming languages like Python
Maintaining and improving scripts and libraries used for data processing and delivery




QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

2nd year or beyond in University studying a technical subject including but not limited to Computer Science, Mathematics, or Data Science
Ability to write and troubleshoot SQL queries
Moderate knowledge of Python, and some familiarity with the major data processing libraries like pandas, dask, and pyspark
Familiarity with software engineering techniques and practices such as unit testing, CI/CD pipelines, containerized environments, and version control
Knowledge of cloud environments like Azure and AWS an asset
Excellent problem solving skills; including the ability to quickly and accurately locate documentation via search engine
Ability to help solve problems and develop solutions while working with stakeholders around the business




Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please advise when submitting your application.




Please note that Tilray does not authorize, engage, or sponsor any consultants, agencies or organizations that seek certain personal or financial information from you (e.g. passwords, login ids, credit card information). High Park does not charge any application, processing or onboarding fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process.




When replying to emails, please ensure the sender name and email address match exactly. Please also ensure the Reply-To address matches the sending address exactly.

If you are concerned about the authenticity of an email, letter, or call purportedly from, for, or on behalf of High Park, please send an email inquiry to infosec@tilray.com

Title: Application Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities:

Installation, configuration, troubleshooting, integration of end-to-end solution
Documentation (project specific and internal) of end-to-end solution
Resolution of incidents and problems
Plan, test and execute changes, including coordination, planning and notification about changes
Facilitate second line support / ticket handling / changes in collaboration with NOC using Service Now
Escalate incidents, problems and changes to R&D for third line support in timely manner when product changes or deeper analysis is needed
Meet SLA targets and service operations KPIs
Trigger problem tickets regarding monitoring and event management, such as incorrect or missing alerts
Perform needed or on demand health checks of services/solutions and maintenance windows to ensure visibility for NOC team
Support Cloud & DC Manager with information to be used in capacity planning
Perform regular documentation of service operations activities and ensure knowledge sharing within Professional Services
Key Management functions including key ceremonies and documentation.
Maintain CMDB and knowledge base in accordance with processes and tools provided
Provide technical input to Customer Service Manager in regards to incident and problem report creation
Support Customer Service Managers in SLA reporting to customers in regards to solution and other KPIs
Manage time in accordance with planned and assigned activities to ensure accuracy and quality in planning
Follow Service Delivery & Operations global policies, procedures and tools
Meet compliance and information security requirements in Service Operations and provide input in relation to requested reports to Security Manager and Service Quality Manager
Timely and accurate time reporting

Qualifications:

Work Experience

Minimum of 4 years of application experience in similar position
Experience in R&D and IT
Experience from incident and problem resolution as well as changes
Experience from installation, configuration, troubleshooting, integration of software solutions
Preferably Telecommunications and/or Payment industry experience
Preferably experience of working across different cultures
Software development experience
Experience from working with automation/scripting related to software application

Skills and Competencies

Expertise on Linux\Red Hat based systems administration, monitoring and troubleshooting bottlenecks including performance, network and memory issues
3+ years of experience in Docker with hands on knowledge on creating, updating and scaling docker and microservices applications
2+ years of experience setting up Kubernetes clusters at Enterprise level and install, manage, monitor and troubleshoot issues with end-to-end ownership
Hands on experience in Splunk 7.x configuration on an enterprise architecture, setting up forwarders, managing indexes, creating dashboards and performing upgrades, with knowledge of Splunk query language.
Expertise on scripting and automation using ansible, creating playbooks and configuration management with limited manual intervention
Base level understanding of SQL databases (ideally Oracle)
Knowledge in Apache, Tomcat, Java applications
Knowledge of Managed File Transfer software such as GoAnywhere is an asset
Knowledge of ITIL processes and Service Management is an asset.
Knowledge and experience with Thales (formerly SafeNET) HSMs is an asset.
Service specific knowledge related to payment, telecommunication and OEM solutions
Ability to work under pressure and follow processes, procedures and instructions
Being an excellent team player and self-driven for learning and improvement
Fluent written and spoken English
Experience with ticketing and monitoring systems
Education
University degree in Computer Sciences, IT or related technical/engineering field

Working Conditions:

Ability to work in a team environment
Limited travelling is required
Ability to provide level 3 support after-hours
Ability to work flexible hours and weekends to conduct maintenance and upgrades

Title: Software Engineer - Full Stack (Backend-Cloud Focused Python Engineer)
Description:
About Agnostiq

Agnostiq is a Toronto based startup developing software for the quantum era. Agnostiq is the team behind Covalent , a Pythonic workflow tool designed for computational scientists, AI/ML software engineers, and anyone who needs to run experiments on limited or expensive computing resources, including quantum computers, HPC clusters, GPU arrays, and cloud services. You can learn more by visiting www.covalent.xyz , or by visiting our GitHub .

About The Role

As a Software Engineer at Agnostiq, you will work on developing Covalent and its backend systems. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to build and develop technical solutions that address user needs, using different technologies for different projects. You will also build and maintain our processes and tools to ensure productivity and code quality remain high. Covalent is a tool built to remove the operational complexity arising at the intersection of different technologies such as multi-cloud, classical HPC and quantum computing. You will be part of a team that spans a wide spectrum of backgrounds from quantum physics to software engineering in order to solve some of the most important software challenges of the next decade.

Responsibilities:

Leverage your past experience with backend architecture and design patterns into the development of a new web application that is taking its first steps into large scale application.
Introduce modern web development technologies, set high standards and drive best practices for backend development for web applications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain cloud-based applications and services.
Develop microservices and manage infrastructure using Terraform to ensure efficient deployment and scalability of our applications.
Develop and maintain APIs for seamless integration with other applications and services.
Optimize the performance and security of our systems to ensure they are reliable and scalable.
Design and implement new features for our SaaS product using various backend skill sets like database API and system design.
Continuously improve the performance and scalability of our SaaS product through innovation and experimentation.


Requirements:

At least 5 years of experience in full-stack/backend-cloud-focused programming, with previous experience working in product-based startup environments.
At least 3 years of experience in Python including databases, API design and other tools such as FastAPI and SQLAlchemy.
At least 3 years of experience in cloud based technologies
Strong understanding of serverless computing and containerization services such as Docker and Kubernetes
Experience with database services such as AWS RDS and MongoDB Atlas
Familiarity with messaging and queuing services like AWS SQS and RabbitMQ
Experience with content delivery services like AWS CloudFront would be highly valued
Note that this list is not exhaustive and other cloud-based technologies may also be relevant
Experience in Terraform, AWS, and Systems Design
Familiarity with various AWS tech stack
Proven track record of designing and implementing highly scalable and reliable backend systems for SaaS products
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams


Bonus Points:

Critical contribution to open source packages or developing and maintaining open source packages


At Agnostiq, we value innovation, creativity, and a collaborative work environment. We offer competitive compensation packages, flexible work hours, and opportunities for growth and advancement within our organization. We're building a diverse team and welcome applicants whose skills, experiences, and backgrounds can complement one another.

About The Role

As a Software Engineer at Agnostiq, you will work on developing Covalent and its backend systems. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to build and develop technical solutions that address user needs, using different technologies for different projects. You will also build and maintain our processes and tools to ensure productivity and code quality remain high. Covalent is a tool built to remove the operational complexity arising at the intersection of different technologies such as multi-cloud, classical HPC and quantum computing. You will be part of a team that spans a wide spectrum of backgrounds from quantum physics to software engineering in order to solve some of the most important software challenges of the next decade.

Responsibilities:
  • Leverage your past experience with backend architecture and design patterns into the development of a new web application that is taking its first steps into large scale application.
  • Introduce modern web development technologies, set high standards and drive best practices for backend development for web applications.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and maintain cloud-based applications and services.
  • Develop microservices and manage infrastructure using Terraform to ensure efficient deployment and scalability of our applications.
  • Develop and maintain APIs for seamless integration with other applications and services.
  • Optimize the performance and security of our systems to ensure they are reliable and scalable.
  • Design and implement new features for our SaaS product using various backend skill sets like database API and system design.
  • Continuously improve the performance and scalability of our SaaS product through innovation and experimentation.

Requirements:
  • At least 5 years of experience in full-stack/backend-cloud-focused programming, with previous experience working in product-based startup environments.
  • At least 3 years of experience in Python including databases, API design and other tools such as FastAPI and SQLAlchemy.
  • At least 3 years of experience in cloud based technologies
  • Strong understanding of serverless computing and containerization services such as Docker and Kubernetes
  • Experience with database services such as AWS RDS and MongoDB Atlas
  • Familiarity with messaging and queuing services like AWS SQS and RabbitMQ
  • Experience with content delivery services like AWS CloudFront would be highly valued
  • Note that this list is not exhaustive and other cloud-based technologies may also be relevant
  • Experience in Terraform, AWS, and Systems Design
  • Familiarity with various AWS tech stack
  • Proven track record of designing and implementing highly scalable and reliable backend systems for SaaS products
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams

Bonus Points:
  • Critical contribution to open source packages or developing and maintaining open source packages

At Agnostiq, we value innovation, creativity, and a collaborative work environment. We offer competitive compensation packages, flexible work hours, and opportunities for growth and advancement within our organization. We're building a diverse team and welcome applicants whose skills, experiences, and backgrounds can complement one another.

Title: Biostatistician I
Description:
Job Posting #911468




Position: Biostatistician I




Site: Krembil Research Institute/Schroeder Arthritis Institute/Toronto Western Hospital




Department: Rheumatology




Reports to: Principal Investigator




Salary Range: $71, 916 to $89895 per annum commensurate with experience and consistent with UHN Compensation Policy




Hours: 37.5 hours per week




Status: Permanent Full-Time




University Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Biostatistician I in our Psoriatic Disease Research Program.




Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.




The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,600 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.




University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's seven research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.




We are currently looking for an experienced and motivated Biostatistician for the Psoriatic Disease Program providing support for more senior-level biostatisticians with the conduct of clinical research studies. The successful candidate should have a strong biostatistical and coding background, particularly in longitudinal intra-individual variability analyses, measurement of predictor and response variables (linear and logistic regression models) and experience in the field of measurement is an asset. Responsibilities include: contributing to the design and evaluation of new projects; providing sample size calculations; assess feasibility of proposed work; plan and analyze pilot data; helping with writing proposals and reports; ensuring results are presented correctly; helping with preparation of material for stakeholders; attend stakeholder meetings and be prepared to speak to any statistical results or data analysis approaches, participate in statistical discussion during annual scientific meetings, provide regular verbal progress updates on project status; tracking and managing the time lines on all research projects that require statistical processing, ensuring that projects are able to be completed within the time lines defined and meet deadlines for data utilization; Work on multiple projects and manage time effectively; performing data analysis; advise staff in data analysis; communicate results verbally or in written report to the investigator; publications; assisting in writing papers; ensure that methods and results are presented correctly; critically appraise written material; produce graphics; prepare manuscripts for dissemination; troubleshooting issues and contribute to corrective actions in order to meet project requirements.




Qualifications




At minimum, a Master’s degree in Biostatistics or Statistics or recognized equivalent
At minimum, 1 year practical and related experience; statistical design and analysis experience in the healthcare field preferred
Working knowledge and experience with cognitive function is preferred
Skills in the field of measurement sciences is an asset
Experience with survival and regression analysis
Experience with coding in statistical packages (SAS, Python and/or R)
Must have superior skills in experimental design, data management and reporting.
Excellent writing skills, in particular, writing of statistical methodology sections for manuscripts and grants
Organizational and multitasking skills
Computer literacy (Outlook, Microsoft Office, etc.)
Ability to work both independently-accountable for assigned projects, and as part of a team




Vaccines (COVID and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.




If you are interested in making your contribution at UHN, please apply on-line. You will be asked to copy and paste as well as attach your resume and cover letter. You will also be required to complete some initial screening questions.




Posted Date: March 14, 2022 Closing Date: April 14, 2023




For current UHN employees, only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.




UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, persons with disabilities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted.

Title: Software Developer - Remote
Description:
NamSys is seeking highly intelligent and innovative Java Software Developers who truly enjoy developing and delivering elegant SaaS applications. The ideal candidate will have a passion for development and learning new technologies. They are a team player possessing strong analytical as well as technical skills, and are able to communicate the logic behind technical decisions to non-tech stakeholders. They must be comfortable working in an agile environment and have the ability to "take the wheel" when necessary. Responsibilities




Participate in ongoing development of our suite of cloud-based web and mobile (Vaadin, Android) applications
Self-management of small projects covering development, testing, and delivery
Collaborate with partners and internal staff on new projects Qualifications
Minimum 3 years software development business experience
Highly skilled in Java development including efficient function design and popular design patterns
Skilled in object-oriented concepts including abstraction, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, and reflection
Experience in navigating large code bases
Knowledge of traditional and newer databases (e.g. SQL, Redis, DynamoDB) is an important asset
Experience with Agile methodologies
Experience with GIT
Knowledge of Amazon Web Services is an asset
Proven ability to meet deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Personable and able to work directly with customers and partners (in English but Spanish fluency is an asset)
Must be authorized to work in Canada The Perks * Develop Software and work on projects that you'll be proud of! * Competitive salary and growth structure * A health and dental plan, ready for you from Day 1 * An education spend, ready for you from Day 1. Learning and development are key here. * Work in a fun, collaborative, feedback-focused environment. * We're remote, but you better believe the fun doesn't stop - we're committed to meeting in our downtown Toronto office occasionally for days of team building with paid lunches and all the snacks and drinks you can consume. Company Description NamSys Inc. is a well-established software company delivering SaaS solutions for the cash services industry

Title: Backend Developer
Description:
We believe in the power of AR to enhance human capabilities. Augment your career with us.




Who We Are




Interaptix is a spatial computing company leveraging the power of Augmented Reality (AR) to solve real-world problems in the industrial enterprise. Our technology empowers people to overcome challenges and improve safety and productivity. We are pioneering a new paradigm for remote industrial work and delivering measurable impact. Join us to be bold, ahead of the curve, and solve real-world problems using augmented reality and spatial computing.




The technology




Based on years of building bespoke augmented reality solutions for sophisticated industrial, academic, and research applications, we launched the AptixAR platform in 2020. Our cloud-based platform incorporates advanced techniques in human-computer interaction (HCI), machine learning, and computer vision and is accessed through wearable computers, tablets, and mobile phones. AptixAR is an enterprise-grade Augmented Reality (AR) SaaS solution that enables experts to connect with their remote staff in 3D space.




Who We Need




We are looking for a Backend Developer whose responsibilities will include collaborating with our Backend, Web and IOS developers, as well as our UX/UI design team, to improve our AptixAR product.




Responsibilities




Design, develop, and maintain APIs and backend services for the AptixAR platform.
Collaborate with the frontend team to integrate APIs and services with the user interface.
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data storage systems.
Ensure the security, reliability, and scalability of backend services.
Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to maintain high-quality code.
Help shape Interaptix's technical roadmap.




Requirements




Strong experience in developing backend systems and services for enterprise SaaS software.
In-depth knowledge of modern web architectures, databases, and web technologies.
Experience with RESTful APIs, microservices, and serverless architectures.
Experience with cloud-based services and platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with automated testing frameworks and tools.
Familiarity with Git, Postman/Swagger, and other development tools.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.




Nice to have




Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python or Node.js.
Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Familiarity with augmented reality applications.




Why join us




great team, growth opportunity, passion for excellency




At Interaptix, we foster a positive and supportive work environment. Our team is made up of passionate individuals who work collaboratively to achieve our mission. We take ownership of our deliverables and support each other when needed. We also make time for team-building activities such as coffee breaks, gaming nights, and monthly events.




Interaptix is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: KDB Quant Developer - Quant Fund - $CAD 260k Total Comp
Description:
JOB TITLE: KDB+/Q Quant Developer

CLIENT: Prestigious Quantitative Hedge Fund

SALARY: $CAD 280,000 Total Compensation

LOCATION: Toronto




JOB OVERVIEW




As a KDB+/Q Quant Trading Developer you will develop, hands on, a next generation research and analytics trading platform for the one of the largest and most successful Quant Funds in the world!

You will work on large-scale financial data problems in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment, in direct collaboration with Quantitative Researchers and Portfolio Managers where, the solutions you create benefit the entire organization!




PERKS

Ownership of mission-critical greenfield projects.
Innovative, state-of-the-art technology and software.
Intellectually stimulating atmosphere with like-minded people, tackling the toughest problems in the industry.
Beautiful offices with video games, board games, foosball, nap areas and table tennis.
Flat structure – every members’ input is needed, and encouraged, regardless of seniority.
No red tape or endless climbing of corporate ladders.




SKILLS/EXPERIENCE NEEDED:

A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.
Experience in engineering relevant solutions using KDB+/Q on systems of considerable scale and complexity.
Exposure to electronic trading systems or real-time financial data management and analytics.
Previous collaboration with quantitative researchers or traders to understand their needs and design and engineer solutions.




NICE TO HAVE

A passion for technology and an appreciation that it is always changing.
An interest in working with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do




HOW TO APPLY

‘LinkedIn Easy Apply’ with your most updated resume ASAP.

Title: Engineer
Description:
Job Description




Job Description: General Summary




Researches, designs, develops, and tests systems-level software and/or hardware. Designs and coordinates complex engineering projects at the system level. Performs functional decomposition to drive requirements and specifications to both hardware and software. Analyzes information to determine, recommend, and plan installation of a new system or modification of an existing system. Ensures system-level performance and power metrics are met. Drives triage of problems at the system level to determine root cause.




The Display Processing Unit (DPU) is responsible for the conversion, color management and compositing of image streams from other blocks, such as the GPU, CPU, video decoder and camera. It formats, packetizes and synchronizes the composited image for display through display interfaces such as display port, USB-C. DPU functional model is used to develop and analyze display features for the best image quality at lower cost. Chip power and performance for key usage cases is a critical determinant of competitive advantage. As such, performance analysis and power estimates receive high levels of attention throughout the organization.




The Responsibilities Of This Role Include




Support, maintain and improve the display functional modeling infrastructure. Work with display system, hardware and software teams to integrate, develop and validate display features.




Integrate/develop System C TLM models of DPU in the full system TLM SoC platform for performance evaluation and analysis. Develop and integrate components in the display performance platform. Perform performance analysis and correlation with the RTL. Present analysis results and provide recommendations.




Working with the display team power prime and provide DPU power models as the modules evolve in architecture and silicon technology. At various points in the DPU design cycle, from early concept to final silicon realization, models of differing complexity / accuracy are required.




Required Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.




C/C++ programming, scripting, Linux and windows environment.




Excel modelling




Version control software such as git, clearcase




Strong presentation and communication skills




Strong analytical, and time management skills.




Methodical, data oriented, detail oriented Self-motivating .




Preferred Qualifications




Strong background in display system and SoC memory architecture.




Exposure to performance simulators (event & cycle driven modeling) and performance correlation




Performance benchmark/workload analysis and characterization.




Understanding of what factors drive SoC power consumption at architectural / block level.




Grasp and abstraction of complex architectures and usage scenarios.




Comments for Suppliers: - wfh position until the wfh order has been lifted

Title: FrontEnd Engineer
Description:
We exist to modernize the way that vendors and property managers work together. We do this by building industry-specific vendor management & procurement software that connects over 6,000 buildings & 40,000 vendors in a single marketplace. We improve efficiency & reduce cost for property managers while driving new business to vendors across the continent.




We’re one of the fastest-growing Toronto startups, a certified “,” and backed by world-leading SaaS & PropTech funds, including; Bessemer Venture Partners, the former CEO of Twitter, Real Estate leaders, Prudence VC & Navitas Capital.




Our team is passionate about growth, innovation, and collaboration - if you are passionate about making an impact and putting in the work to get there, you’re likely a great fit for our team!




The Role




As a Front End Engineer, you will help our engineering team design and develop elegant front-end solutions. The right candidate will be passionate about challenging, extending, and improving our frontend framework to create exceptional user experiences across our platform and implement them in a modular, scalable manner. At VendorPM, you’ll only work with self-sufficient, autonomous teams - there’s no old-fashioned corporate hierarchy.




What’s In It For You




Pivotal role at a high-growth, venture-backed company.
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive health benefits package including LTD, paramedical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc.
Fully remote work-from-home opportunities, with the option to work from our vibrant downtown Toronto office.
Competitive paid time off package
Work/life balance
Team events
A collaborative, tight-knit team
Ongoing learning and development opportunities
Maternity and parental leave top up.




As a Member Of Our Team, You Will




Design and develop rich front-end experiences and connect with APIs developed by your team.
Collaborate with back-end engineers and the Product team to improve usability, design, and implement solutions.
Collaborate with stakeholders to review requirements and design specifications.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability.
Prioritize maintainability and code reuse to ensure testability.
Engage and contribute your ideas to product features, product analytics, and development processes/tools.




You’re the Missing Piece of the Puzzle

Proficiency in HTML, CSS, (GraphQL is a bonus).
Experience with Javascript, Node.js and TypeScript
Experience with front-end Javascript libraries and frameworks such as React.
Proficiency in web design is a plus.
Strong understanding of SOLID principles and software architecture best practices
Proven ability to lead project initiatives from ideation to completion, including rollout, documentation, monitoring, and analytics.
Familiarity with product and design life cycles and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.
Strong communicator with an independent attitude.

We believe in problem-solving as a team. So why not meet your fellow problem solvers?

We exist to modernize the way that vendors and property managers work together. We do this by building industry-specific vendor management & procurement software that connects over 6,000 buildings & 40,000 vendors in a single marketplace. We improve efficiency & reduce cost for property managers while driving new business to vendors across the continent.


We’re one of the fastest-growing Toronto startups, a certified “,” and backed by world-leading SaaS & PropTech funds, including; Bessemer Venture Partners, the former CEO of Twitter, Real Estate leaders, Prudence VC & Navitas Capital.


Our team is passionate about growth, innovation, and collaboration - if you are passionate about making an impact and putting in the work to get there, you’re likely a great fit for our team!


The Role


As a Front End Engineer, you will help our engineering team design and develop elegant front-end solutions. The right candidate will be passionate about challenging, extending, and improving our frontend framework to create exceptional user experiences across our platform and implement them in a modular, scalable manner. At VendorPM, you’ll only work with self-sufficient, autonomous teams - there’s no old-fashioned corporate hierarchy.


What’s In It For You


  • Pivotal role at a high-growth, venture-backed company.
  • Competitive compensation
  • Comprehensive health benefits package including LTD, paramedical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc.
  • Fully remote work-from-home opportunities, with the option to work from our vibrant downtown Toronto office.
  • Competitive paid time off package
  • Work/life balance
  • Team events
  • A collaborative, tight-knit team
  • Ongoing learning and development opportunities
  • Maternity and parental leave top up.


As a Member Of Our Team, You Will


  • Design and develop rich front-end experiences and connect with APIs developed by your team.
  • Collaborate with back-end engineers and the Product team to improve usability, design, and implement solutions.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to review requirements and design specifications.
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
  • Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability.
  • Prioritize maintainability and code reuse to ensure testability.
  • Engage and contribute your ideas to product features, product analytics, and development processes/tools.


You’re the Missing Piece of the Puzzle


  • Minimum of 2 years of Software Development experience.
  • Proficiency in HTML, CSS, (GraphQL is a bonus).
  • Experience with Javascript, Node.js and TypeScript
  • Experience with front-end Javascript libraries and frameworks such as React.
  • Proficiency in web design is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of SOLID principles and software architecture best practices
  • Proven ability to lead project initiatives from ideation to completion, including rollout, documentation, monitoring, and analytics.
  • Familiarity with product and design life cycles and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.
  • Strong communicator with an independent attitude.


Meet Your Fellow Problem-Solvers


We believe in problem-solving as a team. So why not meet your fellow problem solvers?

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Position Title: Software Developer




Position Type: Regular - Full-Time




Position Location: Toronto HQ




Requisition ID: 21870




We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.




Team Overview




Earth Observation at McCain operates as a new, independent start-up division under McCain Foods Limited. Through the use of satellite and other remote sensing technologies, the business unit delivers crop insights to McCain agriculture, farmers, and other non-competitive crop buyers to improve decision-making on crop production and agricultural practices under climate volatility.




The business unit aims to deliver data insight services globally across McCain and commercialize its offering for potato and other crops. We are a new, growing team looking to quickly scale this exciting technology.




This team will advance McCain’s commitments to regenerative agriculture through smart and sustainable farming practices. Its growth feeds into McCain's purpose with sustainability at the heart of producing delicious, planet-friendly food.




Job Purpose




As a software developer you will work in a small team with developers and data scientists to develop, operate and maintain our automated data processing pipeline within AWS to provide agricultural metric data to meet our customers’ needs. You will work on a variety of projects to research and analyze technical and system needs with goals such as integrating statistical and machine learning based models.




This role can operate remotely if the individual prefers. Hybrid and in-office work arrangements are also available within McCain’s office footprint (primarily Toronto and Florenceville).




Key Job Responsibilities




Work in a small team building new and innovative products in the world of agriculture
Work with data scientists and engineers to ensure newly developed crop metrics are integrated efficiently at scale in our processing pipeline
Continuous improvement of our pipeline performance, security, stability, and availability
Continuously develop Docker containers
Be involved with all technical activities within the team such as estimating, sprint planning, software development life cycle activities, code reviews, testing, deployments and documentation creation
Travel within Canada at least once per quarter for in-person team meetings and events




Key Qualification & Experiences




2 – 5 years of experience working in a similar role
Required Skills:
3+ years experience in application development, developing reliable, scalable and well-documented applications
2+ years experience with Python
Intermediate to expert experience with relational database solutions (Postgres, MySQL)
Intermediate experience with Docker
Experience with testing frameworks like pytest
Familiar with CI tools like CircleCI, Jenkins, etc.
Valued Skills:
Interest in agriculture, food systems, or sustainability
Knowledge of Python libraries such as Flask, SQLAlchemy, etc
Experience with front-end frameworks like Angular, React, Javascript
Experience with AWS platform and its tools such as ECS (Fargate), Lambda, Cognito or equivalent in other cloud platforms (GCS, Azure)
Experience with data warehousing solutions (Snowflake, Redshift, etc)
Familiar with artifact repositories like CodeArtifacts
Experience workflow management frameworks such as Step Functions, etc…
Experience with business intelligence tools such as PowerBI, Superset
Knowledge of machine learning lifecycle




The above information indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.




McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse, antiracist, inclusive, merit-based, and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

The health and safety of McCain employees and their families has been our number one priority since the start of COVID-19 pandemic. With vaccination restrictions easing across the globe we do not currently require employees to be vaccinated, but we reserve the right to change this mandate in line with health guidance and regulations in each country.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Privacy Policy

Job Family: Information Technology

Division: Global Technology

Department: Predictive Crop Intelligence – Engineering

Location(s): CA - Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Company: McCain Foods (Canada)
